member.name: M:IdeaBlade.UI.WinForms.InfragisticsControls.UltraCheckEditorDataBinder.InitializeControl(System.Windows.Forms.Control,IdeaBlade.UI.ViewDescriptor)
member.summary: Initializes the properties of a control before being bound.
member.remarks:
The logic for initializing whether the control should support three states is as follows:
If the developer uses the DefaultConverter's defaults, then the control's ThreeState value is used.
If the developer modifies the DefaultConverter's Editability, then the converter's Editability overrides the control.
If the developer selects the ThreeStateConverter and uses the converter's defaults, then the converter's ThreeState value is used.
If the developer selects the ThreeStateConverter, keeps Editability.Optional, and modifies the ThreeState, then the converter's ThreeState value is used.
If the developer selects the ThreeStateConverter and modifies the Editability, then the converter's Editability overrides its ThreeState.

member.summary: Property on the control that is set during binding.

member.summary: Get the TextEditorControlBase for the preferred control type.

member.name: M:IdeaBlade.UI.WinForms.InfragisticsControls.UltraCheckEditorColumnBinder.BindColumn(IdeaBlade.UI.WinForms.InfragisticsControls.UltraGridBindingDescriptor)
member.summary: Sets the properties on a GridColumn from a ViewDescriptor.
member.remarks:
Logic for initializing whether the column should support three states is as follows:
If the developer uses the DefaultConverter's defaults, then the column's style value is used.
If the developer modifies the DefaultConverter's Editability, then the converter's Editability overrides the column.
If the developer selects the ThreeStateConverter and uses the converter's defaults, then the converter's ThreeState value is used.
If the developer selects the ThreeStateConverter, keeps Editability.Optional, and modifies the ThreeState, then the converter's ThreeState value is used.
If the developer selects the ThreeStateConverter and modifies the Editability, then the converter's Editability overrides its ThreeState.

member.summary: The base type of control this binder works with.

member.name: T:IdeaBlade.UI.WinForms.InfragisticsControls.UltraGridBindingManager
member.summary: Manages the data binding between a list of business objects and an Infragistics UltraGrid.
member.remarks:
The determines the type of business object to be managed. The is the that contains one or more business objects of the BoundType. Use the property to add UltraGridBindingDescriptors to bind columns in the UltraGrid to business object properties. The is the grid control used to display the data. When creating a master-detail or multi-hierarchical grid, use the method to create each UltraGridBand and establish the nested relationship.
When using the UltraGridBindingManager it is not necessary for you to set the UltraGrid's DataSource and DataMember properties, since the bindings will be managed by DevForce.

example.code:
Private Sub SimpleGridBinding() Dim pm As PersistenceManager = PersistenceManager.DefaultManager
' setup bindings Dim mgr As New UltraGridBindingManager(mUltraGrid, GetType(Customer)) mgr.Descriptors.Add("Customer", "CompanyName") mgr.Descriptors.Add("Contact", "ContactName") mgr.Descriptors.Add("Phone", "Phone") mgr.Descriptors.Add("City", "City")
' get some data mgr.BindingSource.DataSource = pm.GetEntities(Of Customer)() End Sub

member.name: M:IdeaBlade.UI.WinForms.InfragisticsControls.UltraGridBindingManager.#ctor
member.summary: Constructs an UltraGridBindingManager with a default data source.

member.name: M:IdeaBlade.UI.WinForms.InfragisticsControls.UltraGridBindingManager.#ctor(System.Type)
member.summary: Constructs an UltraGridBindingManager for the specified BoundType.

member.name: M:IdeaBlade.UI.WinForms.InfragisticsControls.UltraGridBindingManager.#ctor(Infragistics.Win.UltraWinGrid.UltraGrid,System.Type)
member.summary: Constructs an UltraGridBindingManager for the specified UltraGrid and BoundType.

member.name: M:IdeaBlade.UI.WinForms.InfragisticsControls.UltraGridBindingManager.#ctor(Infragistics.Win.UltraWinGrid.UltraGrid,System.Windows.Forms.BindingSource)
member.summary: Constructs an UltraGridBindingManager for the specified UltraGrid and binding source.

member.name: M:IdeaBlade.UI.WinForms.InfragisticsControls.UltraGridBindingManager.AddRelationBand(IdeaBlade.UI.WinForms.InfragisticsControls.UltraGridBindingManager,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Adds an UltraGridBand to create a nested grid.
member.param: Binding Manager for the child grid
Display name of the relation.
Property path

example.code:
Private Sub MasterDetailGridBinding()
' Sample 3-level display of customers, orders and order details Dim bindingSource As New BindingSource() bindingSource.DataSource = GetType(Customer)
Dim mgrMaster As New UltraGridBindingManager(mUltraGrid, bindingSource) mgrMaster.Descriptors.Add("Customer", "CompanyName") mgrMaster.Descriptors.Add("Contact", "ContactName") mgrMaster.Descriptors.Add("Phone", "Phone") mgrMaster.Descriptors.Add("City", "City") mgrMaster.AssociatedBand.Header.Caption = "Customers"
Dim mgrChild As New UltraGridBindingManager(GetType(Order)) mgrChild.Descriptors.Add("#", "Id") mgrChild.Descriptors.Add("Order Date", "OrderDate") mgrChild.Descriptors.Add("Freight", "Freight") mgrMaster.AddRelationBand(mgrChild, "Orders", "Orders") mgrChild.AssociatedBand.HeaderVisible = True
Dim mgrDetail As New UltraGridBindingManager(GetType(OrderDetail)) mgrDetail.Descriptors.Add("Product", "Product.ProductName") mgrDetail.Descriptors.Add("Qty", "Quantity") mgrDetail.Descriptors.Add("Price", "UnitPrice") mgrChild.AddRelationBand(mgrDetail, "Details", "OrderDetails") mgrDetail.AssociatedBand.HeaderVisible = True
' Get some data bindingSource.DataSource = PersistenceManager.DefaultManager.GetEntities(Of Customer)() End Sub
